channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: World leaders to hold emergency summit on Greenland. And, SCOTUS weighs Fed case
item.description: European leaders hold an emergency summit on a possible U.S.-Greenland deal. And, the Supreme Court weighs whether the president can fire Fed governors.
item.content:encoded:
European leaders hold an emergency summit on a possible U.S.-Greenland deal. And, the Supreme Court weighs whether the president can fire Fed governors.

(Image credit: Mandel Ngan)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Some voters who backed Trump say ICE is going 'too far'
item.description: A new focus group of Biden-to-Trump voters weighs in on immigration operations and Trump's foreign affairs leadership on Greenland and Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
A new focus group of Biden-to-Trump voters weighs in on immigration operations and Trump's foreign affairs leadership on Greenland and Venezuela.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen)
item.dc:creator: Ashley Lopez

item.title: Trump vs. U.S. allies: How will this end?
item.description: The president has backed off his threat to take Greenland by force. But his highly inflammatory remarks in Switzerland rattled U.S. allies and threatened to tear down the pillars of the world order.
item.content:encoded:
The president has backed off his threat to take Greenland by force. But his highly inflammatory remarks in Switzerland rattled U.S. allies and threatened to tear down the pillars of the world order.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Greg Myre

item.title: Rahm Emanuel steers a course between 'monopolists' and 'Marxists'
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with longtime Democrat Rahm Emanuel about politics in the Trump era.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Steve Inskeep speaks with longtime Democrat Rahm Emanuel about politics in the Trump era.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: Jack Smith to defend Trump investigations to House Republicans
item.description: Jack Smith's appearance before the House Judiciary Committee marks the first open testimony about his work after presiding over two federal criminal indictments of President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Jack Smith's appearance before the House Judiciary Committee marks the first open testimony about his work after presiding over two federal criminal indictments of President Trump.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Carrie Johnson

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: European leaders to meet for emergency summit about the U.S. and Greenland, Trump's statements about Greenland threaten long-standing world order, SCOTUS weighs Trump's power to fire Fed governors.
item.content:encoded: European leaders to meet for emergency summit about the U.S. and Greenland, Trump's statements about Greenland threaten long-standing world order, SCOTUS weighs Trump's power to fire Fed governors.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: The ICE surge is fueling fear and anxiety among Twin Cities children
item.description: Some families aren't leaving their homes as aggressive ICE operations continue in Minnesota, leaving their children confined and stressed. Across the Twin Cities, kids are anxious and afraid.
item.content:encoded:
Some families aren't leaving their homes as aggressive ICE operations continue in Minnesota, leaving their children confined and stressed. Across the Twin Cities, kids are anxious and afraid.

(Image credit: Evan Frost for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Israeli fire strikes journalists and children in Gaza
item.description: Israeli forces on Wednesday killed at least 11 Palestinians in Gaza, including two boys, three journalists and a woman, hospitals said, on one of the enclave 's deadliest days since the ceasefire took effect.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli forces on Wednesday killed at least 11 Palestinians in Gaza, including two boys, three journalists and a woman, hospitals said, on one of the enclave 's deadliest days since the ceasefire took effect.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Autopsy finds Cuban immigrant in ICE custody died of homicide due to asphyxia
item.description: A Cuban migrant held in solitary confinement at an immigration detention facility in Texas died after guards held him down, according to an autopsy report released Wednesday that ruled the death a homicide.
item.content:encoded:
A Cuban migrant held in solitary confinement at an immigration detention facility in Texas died after guards held him down, according to an autopsy report released Wednesday that ruled the death a homicide.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Confused by all the notices issued for intense winter weather? Here's your guide
item.description: The National Weather Service issues a litany of notices before and during inclement weather events. They can be important signals on how to respond.
item.content:encoded:
The National Weather Service issues a litany of notices before and during inclement weather events. They can be important signals on how to respond.

(Image credit: Nam Y. Huh)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie
